column4: hey all... I just finished installation of latest version of Ubuntu, the thing is this, My partition "D" and "E" are NTFS is that ok? because I'm coming from Windows Vista and I did't format that partitions, sure i change the format of that partitions that are NTFS ?
you can't/shouldn't install ubuntu to D or E, but otherwise its fine
you generally cannot "just change" partitions. upgrades do exist for ext2->ext3->ext4->btrfs but not for other combinations
thanks )
might i sound funny but i would like to ask, is that true that Linuxes in this case(Ubuntu) never get infected with viruses ?
generally speaking no. for a number of reasons
so there is possibility that even Ubuntu can be infected with some viruses ?
its not something one usually worries about but yes it is possible.
thanks:) i hope it wont happen with me )
in common terminology "viruses" there are lots of terms depending on how it is transmitted and what it does
obsessed with swap... during the install there isn't anywhere to swap to (usually) so it might be 0
thanks
and my last question, my player Banshee sometimes gets stuck, its just freeze, is that mean im doing something wrong or its common thing?
no idea, ask the channel
never happened with u ever ?
never used it
oh i see... so could you suggest me whichever you use ??
don't listen to music on my computer please ask the channel
ok thanks :)

sorry for bothering recently i have download "Me TV" program but disliked it, i uninstalled it, but icon left in my "Media Apps" as i click on it, it makes no action and no reaction because it has been removed, so how can i remove the icon from "Media Apps"
if apt installed the .desktop file then be sure to purge the application. if not you could remove it manually. if you added it with alacarte remove it there
